result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason W. Schiltz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant's bond of $200.00 has been applied towards the costs.

Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.  Defendant shall have no contact with B.G.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by his probation agent.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall submit to an AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason W. Schiltz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation

Defendant Jason W. Schiltz in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Plea of no contest to DC - Domestic - Count 1. Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 1- disorderly conduct - domestic.  Court orders withheld sentence probation 2 years with conditions of court costs including domestic abuse assessment; DNA sample and surcharge; no contact with B.G.; AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation agent.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Jason W. Schiltz in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waive reading of complaint.  Plea of not guilty to criminal charges and plea of not guilty to two traffic citations - Case Nos. 15TR547 and 15TR487.    Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  - rt

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $200.00 cash bond and a $1,000.00 signature bond; booking; no possession or consumption of alcohol and no contact with B.G.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney. Next court date is scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  - rt
